election_record.label: New Hampshire 1822 Governor

overview.note: "Samuel Bell, our present worthy Chief Magistrate, is again re-elected to the office of Governor, by perhaps a greater majority than was ever before given for any candidate. No opposition has been organized against him: his acknowledged impartiality and talents have generally silenced objections, and even those who at his first election were violently opposed to him, are now obliged to confess, they have no fault to find with his administration, and say they will cheerfully support it." New-Hampshire Patriot and State Gazette (Concord, NH). March 18, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Cheshire
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns list George B. Upham with 302 votes but the town totals add up to 309.

sub_unit.name: Concord
sub_unit.note: Jeremiah Mason received 1 vote as Jer Mason.

sub_unit.name: Kingston
sub_unit.note: Jeremiah Mason received 22 votes as Jer Mason.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. New Hampshire Archives and Records Management, Concord.
